subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] learning
msgSnippet: Congrats on your son learning it.  Its a handy thing to know, and your brain learns this kind of thing much better when you re young. Generally speaking,
messageBody:
Congrats on your son learning it. Its a handy thing
to know, and your brain learns this kind of thing much
better when you're young.

Generally speaking, quickscript is supposed to be
phoentic, so you should write words as you would
pronounce them. The only problem might be if you have
trouble recognizing the words later.

Alex


--- branain <zauniar@...> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I discovered this site and the Read Alphabet a few
> weeks ago. I
> decided to learn it. I really love it. Even my
> 10-year-old son has
> started to learn it.
>
> Do you have any suggestions on how to learn and
> practice this
> wonderful writting system?
>
> I pretty much can grasp all the sounds, but I have a
> little problem
> with the "ah" in "alms" & "ox" sounds. I pronounce
> them pretty much
> the same. I'm from New York, I wonder if that makes
> a difference? Is
> it acceptable to interchange them in my case, as I
> do not
> differentiate between them?
>
> Thanks,
> Chris
>
>


__________________________________

Congrats on your son learning it.  Its a handy thing
to know, and your brain learns this kind of thing much
better when you're young.

Generally speaking, quickscript is supposed to be
phoentic, so you should write words as you would
pronounce them.  The only problem might be if you have
trouble recognizing the words later.  

Alex
